revised_title: Experimental Determination of Transition Probabilities for Argon Lines
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using a shock tube to measure the temperature in hot gases and determined the transition probabilities of 13 argon spectrum lines. They used a double-diaphragm detonating driver tube to obtain accurate temperature measurements and corrected for self-absorption in the stronger red lines. The results can be used to determine temperatures in argon in the range of 6000 to 12000 K from the ratio of line intensities.
